file_content.text: Welcome back, General. My scouts say they've never seen such a decisive victory.
I wonder if there's room on the cruiser for my office? I'd much rather be up there than down here.
Let me get this straight... not only did you save millions of lives, but you and your strike team seized an Imperial battle cruiser.
Nope. Doesn't sound any less incredible when I say it out loud.
The rogue Jedi you were after--did you catch him?
Master Braga is no longer under the Emperor's control. He's returning to Tython.
He's on his way to Tython.
Not sure how I feel about him going free. At least he isn't our problem anymore.
Master Braga was beyond redemption. I had to kill him.
He's dead.
A lot of people will sleep better knowing he's gone.
I convinced Master Braga to switch sides. He's attacking Imperial positions as we speak.
He's fighting for us, now.
He's still classified as an enemy combatant. We can't guarantee his safety. Hope that won't be a problem.
The general should be here. What's his status?
Where is General Var Suthra?
The Jedi Council asked me to keep that to myself. What matters is, he's no longer a threat to Corellia.
[Lie] That's top secret.
If Jedi weren't famous for their honesty, I'd think you were giving us the brush-off.
We've got the Empire running. Their command-and-control network is in shambles. These Jedi troops performed brilliantly.
I'm recommending this brave Jedi army for the Republic's top military honor. You've all earned it.
The Jedi Order is grateful for the recognition.
Thank you, General.
Jedi don't serve in the hope of recognition. We do it because we must.
Medals aren't necessary.
Well, I don't award medals to make myself feel better. I do it because I must.
It's nice to see the Republic military finally acknowledge the Jedi Order.
Yes, we did.
There have been too many hard feelings since your people left Coruscant. It's time we put that behind us and work together.
I know you can't stay, but Corellia needs the rest of us. This battle isn't over by a long shot.
I promise I'll take good care of your people here. May the Force be with you.
I wish I had good news, but the general's mission was not successful. He didn't have the forces he needed.
They put up a good fight, but the enemy had superior numbers. There were no survivors.
All those soldiers and Jedi, gone. The cost of this battle was too high.
That's horrible news.
Those soldiers and Jedi saved Corellia. They kept the enemy busy so I could complete my mission.
It was a noble sacrifice.
They'll be recognized for their service.
It could've been worse. We could all be dead.
War happens.
I suppose, when you look at it that way....
There's still plenty of fighting to be done. The Empire is down, but it's already regrouping.
I'd ask you to stay, but I get the feeling you've already got one foot out the door. Good luck.
Want to hear something sad? I'm not allowed to retreat. Hope you shut down those reactors.
The general has been waiting for you.
If you're here to check something out, the librarian is dead.
Your friend offered to stay and fight. I figure one Jedi is still better than none.
Corellia has become a Jedi graveyard. After all our sacrifices, I can't abandon it. I have to see this through.
I'm leaving Corellia in good hands. Be careful out there.
May the Force be with you.
May the Force guide and protect you, Supreme Commander. Farewell.
I'm placing you in charge of all Jedi forces on Corellia until Master Satele says otherwise.
You're supreme commander, now.
Considering I'm the only Jedi left, that isn't much of a promotion.
It has been an education serving under you--one I will not forget. Farewell.
There are so few of us left. I do not think that promotion will be necessary.
May the Force be with you. Farewell.
You won't last long without me to watch your back.
I don't expect you'll survive.
There is no death; there is only the Force. Farewell, Supreme Commander.
Your strike team volunteered to stay and fight. We won't turn down the offer.
Corellia has become a Jedi graveyard. After all our sacrifices, we can't abandon it. We have to see this through.
If not for cannon fire from the cruiser, the general would be dead. His entire platoon and one of your Jedi squads didn't make it.
I'm thankful General Var Suthra lived. He's a great leader.
At least the general survived.
He's a tough old man, I'll give him that.
Welcome back, General. My scouts tell me your people had it rough out there.
We took down several command-and-control centers. Might be the edge we need to win this sector.
We were aided by some timely cannon fire from that cruiser. Your doing, I assume? Much appreciated.
But casualties were high. I lost half my platoon and two squads of Jedi.
I'll recommend everyone who gave their lives today for the Republic's highest honor.
Are dead Jedi the only ones who qualify for medals?
What about the rest of us?
No, no--of course not. You've all earned the recognition.
I will stay and fight. I owe it to the men who died for me aboard that cruiser.
The Jedi here will need a leader. I can't think of anyone more qualified than you.
You're supreme commander, now.
That is a great honor--and an even greater responsibility. I won't let you down. Farewell.
With your strike team joining us, I feel a lot more confident of victory.
It has been a great honor serving with you. I feel ready to take on the whole galaxy.
I assume that cannon fire from the cruiser was your doing. Good timing. Saved my skin.
It is good to see you alive, Supreme Commander. Did you find Master Braga?
I was able to use the cruiser's weapons and aid the general, but... my teammates died protecting me from an enemy counterattack.
I hope their sacrifice wasn't in vain. Did you find Master Braga?
